DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study was to examine the efficacy of dynamic splinting as a therapeutic modality in reducing contracture following surgical treatment of distal radius fractures.
DOC.criteria: Distal radius fracture treated with surgical management and wrist flexion contracture upon follow up Carpal Fractures (Scaphoid, Lunate, Hamate, and Trapezium) Radial nerve entrapment Arthrodesis Traumatic dislocation of the distal ulna
